comment: She is not a good professor in my opinion. She is polite but makes you feel dumb very often. Straight up told some girl her presentation was terrible one time. Too many activities and not enough ACTUAL teaching. I did not learn Spanish from her and i had her for two semesters in a row. Don't take her if you can help it
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests are tough

comment: I have taken Joan Jones for three spanish classes in a row and I have to say she was off her game for the Spring 2017 semester. She usually provides lots of extra credit opportunities but this semester she did not.  Also our class average for our first test was a 65 and she refused to curve.  Hard class, usually worth it but not for 2002.

Professor Jones was very rude and condescending. She made me feel inadequate many times throughout the semester. This class is a hard class and her teaching style does not make it easier. There is a lot of homework. Jones is never clear about rubrics or dates. I would not recommend taking her.

I Loved Jones! She is a tough grader but you will actually learn Spanish. She gives plenty of extra credit opportunity and is available to help outside of class. If she was teaching upper division Spanish I would definitely take her again.

I could not finish the class, as growing up around fluent speakers, her Spanish is condescending and mediocre. Her attitude it rude, and she expects too much out of the class. She wastes too much time asking people to translate what she just said into English. I've had much better professors.

She's one of the best Spanish teachers at KSU. I strongly recommend her if you have to take spanish courses. I would definitely take her again. She speaks spanish most of the class period. At first, your head will hurt. but before you know it, you'll understand most of what she's saying. She's very passionate about Spanish and is very organized.

She is awesome. KSU apparently loves to mess with foreign language classes but even though they threw a lot of random "important" assignments at us she still managed to keep a pretty structured class. She speaks in spanish most of the time, but that IS the point of the class. I'd take her for the rest of my span classes if I could
Ms. Jones is always looking for ways to make the material easier to understand.  She offers lots of practice and is willing to help if you are struggling.
Ugh! Her class was SO frustrating. She's constantly modifying the syllabus and drowns higher level speakers in busy work. I really didn't enjoy this class.

Wants us to learn and knows how to help us do well.  Lots of chances to talk in class but not much pressure to do it in front of everyone.  She doesn't try to trick you with pop-quizzes or long papers.  Take her. One of the best.

She's one of the easiest spanish teachers i've ever had, but she's also a really good professor. She gives a lot of  really helpful methods to learning grammar and vocab. Literally just show up to class and study and you'll get an A. Lots of extra credit opportunities.

I have mixed feelings about this professor. I don't think she's a bad professor, just maybe a bit petty? She expects that bc you are in 2002, you know what she needs you to know, so don't ask a "dumb" question. She didn't like it when we went to the bathroom without asking which we aren't in high school. she has a ton compositions and grades tough.

Sra. Jones was very helpful by working with us who needed extra help.  She had study and review sessions several times to help us catch up.  Gave us ways of remembering grammar with words.  One of the best professors I've had.  Take her if you want to learn Spanish but not if you want to slide by.
She marks it wrong if you don't put the accent mark which is total BS. She gives homework after every class including after tests. She doesn't give excused absences.

I only took one class of Spanish before her, and she expects you to know more than a 1002 student should know. She does not grade fairly. She does not grade based on what you should know, but on what other students (who have already had many years of Spanish) know. Do not recommend unless you are taking this class as a refresher.

This is the worst spanish teacher I have ever had. She is so rude. She talks to the class in a condescending tone when you don't undarstand. She is constantly rolling her eyes. She assigns way too many pointless busy work and has the due date set for hw at 9 in the morning.  The work would be tolerable if she didnt have  a bad attitude.

This is the worst spanish teacher I have ever had. She is so RUDE. She talks to the class in a condescending tone when you don't undarstand. She is constantly rolling her eyes. She assignes way too many pointless worksheets and has the due date set for hw at 9 in the morning.  The work would be tolerable if she didnt have  a bad attitude.

One of the best. Always available to explain or give you another chance if you ask. You learn a lot in this class. Lots of online activities on D2L to help. Come to class and do homework for a good grade.

This teacher gives you so much busywork that doesn't help you learn at all. She is useless; your classmates will answer more questions for you than she will because she clearly doesn't get why you aren't understanding and won't even try to hide that she ROLLS HER EYES at questions you should "already know." Easy to understand but condescending.

Professor Jones is excellent. There is a lot of grammar in this class but she gives us ways of remembering the rules and even makes handouts to help us. She really cares about us and if we miss a composition or something major gives us a chance to make it up. Take her.

Senora Jones is a terrible Spanish teacher! She talks to you like you are an infant, so it gets a bit annoying if you can understand the language but can't speak it. She assigns pointless projects and assignments and has been rude to many students on multiple occasions. She ruined my passion for the language and I would not recommend her to anyone!
Best professor I've ever had in Spanish.  She loves what she does and makes the class fun even though the material is difficult.  Explains well and is very patient. Take her class!

By far one of the greatest teachers I have ever had for spanish, and I've been taking it for 4 years. The class is not easy because the subject material is hard but she makes everything clear and easy to remember with helpful diagrams. She's patient, knowledgable, and best of all: easy to understand in BOTH spanish and english. Fantastic professor.

Se√±ora Jones is great! She is so helpful, and reviews with us daily on information that we "should" already know. She's so laid back, and willing to adjust. This class comes with a lot of online homework (basically every night), but that's spanish, right? We play games, converse, and watch videos. At this level- I would highly recommend her!
